data.title: 57 things to do in Alabama over Memorial Day weekend 2019
data.meta_description: What are you doing on Memorial Day weekend? If you haven’t made a plan yet, we’re here to help.
data.text:
What are you doing on Memorial Day weekend? If you haven’t made a plan yet — or simply want an alternative to the beach, lake or backyard — we’re here to help. Plenty of events are planned throughout the state, ranging from solemn patriotic celebrations to festive fireworks. Here are 57 ways to enliven your holiday weekend, May 24-27, 2019.

Image by Stefan Schweihofer from Pixabay

Pepsi Beach Ball Drop

What: Beach ball drop with 5,000 balls to celebrate the season, plus DJ music, children's activities, fireworks and more.

When: May 24, 5 p.m.-9 p.m. Ball drop at at 6:25 p.m.; fireworks at 8:45 p.m.

Where: The Wharf, 23101 Canal Road, Orange Beach.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.alwharf.com

AL.com file photo/Frank Couch

Four Nations Wheelchair Rugby Tournament

What: International competition among wheelchair athletes.

When: May 24, start times 12 p.m.-7 p.m., teams from USA, Japan, Great Britain, Australia compete; May 25, bronze medal game 10 a.m., gold medal game 1 p.m.

Where: Lakeshore Foundation, 4000 Ridgeway Drive, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.lakeshore.org/activity/sports-recreation/tournaments/2019-four-nations-wheelchair-rugby-invitational/

AL.com file photo/Tamika Moore

Concerts on the Dock

What: Artists from CodeName Underground perform. With Shaheed and DJ Supreme, They Call Me Bstill, Ray the Sanger and Ray Ray Russell.

When: May 24 at 6 p.m.

Where: East Dock, Lowe Mill, 2211 Seminole Drive, Huntsville.

Admission: Free, $5 parking donation suggested.

Website: http://www.lowemill.net

Image by Social Butterfly from Pixabay

Family Fun Friday

What: Warm-up and stretching, followed by team activity such as kickball, soccer or wiffle ball.

When: May 24 at 6 p.m.

Where: Railroad Park, 1600 First Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.railroadpark.org

AL.com file photo/Jan-Michael Stump

Cast Iron Bowl Night

What: Sloss metal artists help participants create cast iron bowls. Molds and tools provided.

When: May 24, 6 p.m.- 9 p.m.

Where: Sloss Furnaces, 20 32nd St. North, Birmingham.

Admission: $45.

Website: https://www.slossfurnaces.com

The Veer Union

What: Rock band performs, with NeverWake and She the Devil.

When: May 24 at 8 p.m.

Where: Iron City, 513 22nd St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $15-$25.

Website: https://www.ironcitybham.com

Image by Eric Blochet from Pixabay

“Coppelia,” Act 2

What: Alabama Youth Ballet Company performs.

When: May 24 at 7 p.m.

Where: Virginia Samford Theatre, 1116 26th St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $10-$15 advance, $20 at door.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/AlabamaYouthBallet

Adamsov Production from Pixabay

Daikin Festival

What: Celebration of Japanese food, music, arts and culture.

When: May 24, 6 p.m.-9:30 p.m.

Where: Morgan County Fairgrounds, 2919 Fairground Road, Decatur.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.decaturcvb.org

Image by HeungSoon from Pixabay

Jubilee Pops Concert

What: Montgomery Symphony Orchestra performs.

When: May 24 at 7:30 p.m.

Where: On the lawn of Alabama Department of Archives and History, 624 Washington Ave., Montgomery. Bring blankets, lawn chairs and picnic baskets.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.montgomerysymphony.org/pops-concerts

Image by Al Buettner from Pixabay

Game Night

What: Board games for adults, part of After Hours @ the Plaza series.

When: May 24 at 7 p.m.

Where: Hoover Library, 200 Municipal Drive, Hoover.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://events.hooverlibrary.org/events?v=grid

Image by PaintedFeet01 from Pixabay

Epic Comedy Hour

What: Comedians perform.

When: May 24 at 8 p.m.

Where: Flying Monkey Arts, Lowe Mill, 2211 Seminole Drive, Huntsville.

Admission: $8.

Website: http://www.lowemill.net

Horse Pens 40 Facebook photo

Bluegrass and Craft Fair

What: Music, camping, crafts and food. Lineup includes Rumpke Mountain Boys, Allen Tolbert and the Lads, Clear Blue Sky and more.

When: May 24-25.

Where: Horse Pens 40, 3525 St. Clair County 42, Steele.

Admission: $15-$55.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/HORSE-PENS-40-997444250361459/

Chad Stevens/Kalamazoo Gazette

Rumba Latina Birmingham

What: Latin dancing, with music by DJ Osbeth.

When: May 24 at 8 p.m.

Where: Saturn, 200 41st St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $10

Website: http://www.saturnbirmingham.com

Image by Pexels from Pixabay

RXR Fest

What: Musicians perform, bands TBA.

When: May 24-26, 6 p.m.-10 p.m.

Where: Town Green at Russell Crossroads, 27 Russell Farms Road, Alexander City.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.russellcrossroads.com/events/rxr-fest.html

Taylor Hollingsworth Country Western

What: Birmingham musician performs on a lineup with Ace Carlson and Love Rat.

When: May 25 at 10 p.m.

Where: The Nick, 2514 10th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $8-$10.

Website: http://www.thenickrocks.com

AL.com file photo/Mike Kittrell

Mobile BayBears vs. Biloxi Shuckers

What: Minor league baseball teams play in Southern League.

When: May 24-25 at 7:05 p.m., May 26 at 2:05 p.m.

Where: Hank Aaron Stadium, 755 Bolling Brothers Blvd, Mobile.

Admission: $7-$14.

Website: http://www.milb.com/schedule/index.jsp?sid=t417

Image by Pavlofox from Pixabay

CoalFest

What: Music, crafts, food, cornhole tournament, motorcycle ride, car and truck show, color run and more, celebrating town's mining history.

When: May 24-25.

Where: Various locations in downtown Brilliant, off Main Street and Old Highway 129.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/brilliantalabamacoalfest/

Photo by Paras Griffin/Getty Images for Breakthrough

Arnez J

What: Comedian performs.

When: May 24-26, five performances at various times.

Where: Comedy Club Stardome, 1818 Data Drive, Hoover.

Admission: $33.

Website: http://www.stardome.com

AP Photo/Butch Dill

SEC Baseball Tournament

What: Southeastern Conference college teams compete for championship.

When: May 24-26.

Where: Hoover Metropolitan Stadium, 100 Ben Chapman Drive, Hoover.

Admission: $9-$72.

Website: http://www.secsports.com/article/11037437/championships-baseball

AL.com file photo/Sharon Steinmann

Mobicon

What: Comics, fantasy and sci-fi convention, with guest speakers, cosplay, movies, panel discussions, steampunk ball, vendor booths and more.

When: May 24-26.

Where: Renaissance Mobile Riverview Plaza Hotel, 64 S Water St., Mobile.

Admission: $22.50-$45 weekend, $10-$25 daily.

Website: http://www.mobilecomiccon.org

Courtesy photo/Ashley Kickliter

Opelika Songwriters Festival

What: Forty acts perform, including Kim Richey, Kate Campbell, Shawn Mullins, Jeff Black, Martha's Trouble and Harpeth Rising.

When: May 24-26.

Where: Downtown venues such as Eighth & Rail, Sneak & Dawdle, John Emerald Distillery and Irish Bred Pub,. Most are located on North and South Railroad Avenue, Opelika.

Admission: $90 day pass, $150 two-day pass, $225 three-day VIP pass. VIP passes include brunch on Sunday with an in-the-round concert featuring festival headliners.

Website: https://www.opelikasongwritersfestival.com

Stewart Edmonds/Red Mountain Theatre Co. Facebook photo

"Little Shop of Horrors"

What: Horror comedy rock music by Alan Menken and Howard Ashman, directed by Keith Cromwell.

When: May 24 at 7:30 p.m., May 25 at 2 p.m. and 7:30 p.m., May 26 at 2 p.m.

Where: Red Mountain Theatre Co., Cabaret Theatre, 301 19th St. North, Birmingham.

Admission: $19-$55.

Website: http://redmountaintheatre.org

Image by TIME-OUT Thanks for everything Nicky from Pixabay

Rocket City Fair

What: Carnival rides, games, food vendors, petting zoo, magic show and more.

When: May 24-27.

Where: Joe W. Davis Stadium, 3125 Leeman Ferry Road Southwest, Huntsville.

Admission: $8, $5 for kids ages 5-12, free for those ages 4 and younger.

Website: http://www.rocketcityfair.com

Joe Songer | jsonger@al.com

Alabama Splash Adventure

What: Water park and amusement park opens for the season with "wet and dry" rides.

When: May 24-27, open through Sept. 2.

Where: Alabama Splash Adventure, 4599 Alabama Adventure Parkway, Bessemer.

Admission: $27-$32, free for kids age 2 and younger.

Website: http://www.alabamasplash.com

Image by Ronny Overhate from Pixabay

Chasing Butterflies Walk

What: Fundraiser for Turner Syndrome Society of the United States.

When: May 25 at 8 a.m.

Where: Railroad Park, 1600 First Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $10-$26.50 registration.

Website: https://www.bellesandbutterflies.com

Joe Songer | jsonger@al.com

The Market at Pepper Place

What: Vendors sell fruits and vegetables, crafts, coffee, clothing, other foods and more. With music, cooking demo and art demo.

When: May 25, 7 a.m.-noon.

Where: Pepper Place, 2829 Second Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.pepperplacemarket.com

Image by Capri23auto from Pixabay

Memorial Day Weekend Festival

What: Music, ice cream eating contest, tug of war, water balloon toss and more.

When: May 25, 8 a.m.-6 p.m.

Where: Smith Lake Park, 403 Cullman County 386, Cullman.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.cullmancountyparks.com

Duane Prokop/Getty Images

Birmingham Funk Fest

What: Bobby Brown, Bell Biv Devoe, Jeezy, Monica, Jagged Edge, Da Brat and YoungBloodz perform.

When: May 25 at 5 p.m. Gates open at 3 p.m.

Where: Legion Field, 400 Graymont Ave. West, Birmingham.

Admission: $45-$155.

Website: https://birmingham.funkfesttour.com

Image by Albrecht Fietz from Pixabay

FrogWatch USA Volunteer Certification Class

What: Class teaches participants to identify calls of local frogs and toads while becoming certified in nationwide citizen science initiative to track their populations.

When: May 25 at 5 p.m.

Where: Ruffner Mountain Nature Preserve, 1214 81st St. South Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://ruffnermountain.org

Image by Deborah Jackson from Pixabay

Memorial Day Tribute

What: Guided tours and historical demos on military life from interpreters in U.S. Army uniforms from different eras.

When: May 25, 9 a.m.-3 p.m.

Where: Fort Morgan, 110 Alabama 180, Gulf Shores.

Admission: $4-$7, free for kids age 5 and younger.

Website: http://www.fort-morgan.org

Image by Keturah Moller from Pixabay

Memorial Day Observance

What: Wreath laying ceremony, music, flag placement ceremony, guest speakers, cannon salute and more.

When: Flag placement May 25 at 9 a.m., other events May 27 at 9 a.m.

Where: Alabama National Cemetery, 3133 Alabama 119, Montevallo.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://scalnc.org/programs-at-alnc

Image by Pexels from Pixabay

Yoga by the River

What: Yoga class at nature preserve near Flint River.

When: May 25 at 9 a.m.

Where: Hays Nature Preserve, 7153 U.S. 431 South, Owens Cross Roads.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.huntsvilleal.gov/?s=Yoga+by+the+river

Image by Jill Wellington from Pixabay

Memorial Day Bike Parade

What: Decorate and ride bikes around campground.

When: May 25 at 9 a.m.

Where: Lake Guntersville State Park, 24 State Campground Road, Guntersville.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.alapark.com/memorial-day-bike-parade

Image by Public Co from Pixabay

Bham Emo Dance Party

What: Andy Jackson of Hot Rod Circuit performs with Hey Buddy, followed by dancing to DJ music.

When: May 25 at 9 p.m.

Where: Saturn, 200 41st St. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $5

Website: http://www.saturnbirmingham.com

Stu’s Farewell Show

What: Music by Holy Youth, Dommel Mosel, Taylor Hollingsworth and the Bouquets.

When: May 25 at 8 p.m.

Where: Mom's Basement, 4411 Third Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.momsbham.com

LuLu Palooza

What: Music by Phil & Foster, Lefty Collins, Albert Simpson & John Kulinich and more.

When: May 25, 2 p.m.-7 p.m.

Where: LuLu's, 200 E. 25th Ave, Gulf Shores.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.lulubuffett.com/gulf-shores/

Dennis Pillion | dpillion@al.com

Cahaba Lily Walk

What: Southeastern Outings takes group on easy 5-mile hike at Hargrove Shoals in Bibb County.

When: May 25 at 9:45 a.m.

Where: Group leaves from McDonald's near Riverchase Galleria, 1731 U.S. 31, Hoover.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.seoutings.org

Image by Linda Taylor from Pixabay

Salsa Showdown

What: Restaurants and catering companies offer samples of salsa, guacamole, queso and specialty dips, competing for awards. With music, children's activities and a hot pepper eating contest.

When: May 25, 2 p.m.-6 p.m.

Where: Cahaba Brewing Co., 4500 Fifth Ave. South, Building C, Birmingham.

Admission: $15 advance, $20 at gate, free for kids age 5 and younger. Proceeds benefit Sidewalk Film Festival.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/salsashowdown/

JaVonne Jones

What: Violinist performs jazz music.

When: May 25 at 8:30 p.m.

Where: The Perfect Note, 1845 U.S. 31, Hoover.

Admission: $20-$30

Website: http://www.perfectnotelive.com

Kevin Winter/Getty Images

Thomas Rhett

What: Country artist performs on Very Hot Summer tour, with Dustin Lynch, Russell Dickerson and Rhett Akins.

When: May 25-26 at 7 p.m.

Where: Amphitheater at The Wharf, 23325 Amphitheater Drive, Orange Beach.

Admission: $31.75-$249 via Ticketmaster

Website: http://www.alwharf.com

Image by Casey Budd from Pixabay

Jazz in the Park

What: Deirdre Gaddis and Melvin Miller perform.

When: May 26 at 6 p.m.

Where: Huffman High School, 950 Springville Road, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.magiccitysmoothjazz.com

Natchez Tracers

What: Country funk band performs on a lineup with Stone Floor Theory and GreenLeaf Hustle.

When: May 25 at 10 p.m.

Where: The Nick, 2514 10th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $8.

Website: http://www.thenickrocks.com

AL.com file photo

Alabama Jubilee Hot Air Balloon Classic

What: Festival with hot air balloons, arts and crafts, antique tractor show, live music, fireworks and more.

When: May 25-26.

Where: Point Mallard Park, 2901 Point Mallard Drive Southeast, Decatur.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.alabamajubilee.net

Image by Albrecht Fietz from Pixabay

Art on the Lake

What: More than 40 artists and crafters display their works. Part of proceeds from sales benefits Children's Harbor.

When: May 25-26.

Where: Children's Harbor, Lake Martin, 1 Our Children's Highway, Alexander City.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.childrensharbor.com/artonthelake.php#.XNX9Rq2ZNao

Joe Songer | jsonger@al.com

Collectors and Shooters Gun Show

What: Gun Show organized by Collectors and Shooters company.

When: May 25, 9 a.m.-5 p.m.; May 26, 10 a.m.-4 p.m.

Where: Von Braun Center, South Hall, 700 Monroe St. Southwest, Huntsville.

Admission: $9.

Website: https://www.vonbrauncenter.com/event/collectors-and-shooters-gun-show/275/

Soulful Sunday

What: Saxophonist Ves Marable performs.

When: May 26 at 2 p.m.

Where: The Perfect Note, 1845 U.S. 31, Hoover.

Admission: Free, minimum purchase required in dining room with stage area.

Website: http://www.perfectnotelive.com

Image by Free-Photos from Pixabay

Guided Hike: Mining History with Gary Bostany

What: Guided hike covers more than 3 miles, lasts about three hours, focuses on early mining at Sloss-Sheffield Mines and relics remaining at Ruffner Mountain.

When: May 26, 1 p.m.-4 p.m. Meet at Nature Center.

Where: Ruffner Mountain Nature Preserve, 1214 81st St. South Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://ruffnermountain.org

Image by NikolayFrolochkin from Pixabay

Out Loud HSV Poetry Slam

What: Poets perform in three-minute segments; audiences members judge their efforts until a winner is chosen.

When: May 26 at 6 p.m.

Where: Flying Monkey Arts, Lowe Mill, 2211 Seminole Drive, Huntsville.

Admission: Free, donations encouraged.

Website: http://www.lowemill.net

Kamal Akeem

What: DJ performs, on a lineup with King Tall T, Carey Fountain and Naps205.

When: May 26 at 10 p.m.

Where: The Nick, 2514 10th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $6-8.

Website: http://www.thenickrocks.com

Image by Ilona Frey from Pixabay

Cotton Row Run

What: 10K and 5K races, plus 1 mile fun run.

When: May 27 at 7 a.m.

Where: Start at Church Street by Big Spring Park East, Huntsville.

Admission: $40 registration for 5K or 10K, $70 for both, $15 for fun run.

Website: http://cottonrowrun.com

Image by Liam Ortiz from Pixabay

Memorial Day Program

What: Ceremony with guest speaker Maj. Gen. Janet Cobb, music, gun salute and more.

Where: Tuscaloosa Veterans Memorial Park, McFarland Boulevard East, near University Mall, Tuscaloosa.

When: May 27 at 9 a.m.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.tuscaloosaveteranspark.org

AL.com file photo/Bernard Troncale

Memorial Day at American Village

What: Salutes to veterans, historical re-enactments and family-friendly activities.

When: May 27, 10:30 a.m.-3:30 p.m., gates open at 10 a.m.

Where: American Village, 3727 Alabama 119, Montevallo.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.americanvillage.org

Image by Zack Culver from Pixabay

Memorial Day Ceremony

What: Ceremony sponsored by Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 4919.

When: May 27 at 11 a.m.

Where: 419 N. Raleigh Ave., Sheffield.

Admission: Free.

Website: https://www.facebook.com/VFW4919/

Hip-Hop Cardio

What: High-endurance exercise class features choreography inspired by hip-hop.

When: May 27 at 6 p.m.

Where: Railroad Park, 1600 First Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: Free.

Website: http://www.railroadpark.org

MOJO Jazz Jambalaya

What: Roman Street performs.

When: May 27 at 6:30 p.m.

Where: Central ArtSanctuary, Bellingrath Hall, Central Presbyterian Church, 1260 Dauphin St., Mobile.

Admission: $15, includes jambalaya dinner.

Website: http://mojojazz.org/

Image by Cornelia Schneider-Frank from Pixabay

Birmingham Bandstand

What: Open microphone, with hostess Dr. D.

When: May 27 at 8 p.m.

Where: The Nick, 2514 10th Ave. South, Birmingham.

Admission: $3.

Website: http://www.thenickrocks.com

Image by Heiko Stein from Pixabay

Sparks After Dark

What: Fireworks show.

When: May 27 at 8:45 p.m.

Where: The Wharf, 23101 Canal Road, Orange Beach.

Admission: Free.
